definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover

sentences.english: I've never had a friend who would rish his life for me.
sentences.chinese: 我還沒有能冒死救我的朋友呢。

sentences.english: and to think that my father fought for you, risked his life to rescue you from the hand of Midian
sentences.chinese: 從前我父冒死爲你們爭戰，救了你們脫離米甸人的手。

sentences.english: For my father fought for you, and adventured his life far, and delivered you out of the hand of Midian
sentences.chinese: 從前我父冒死爲你們爭戰，救了你們脫離米甸人的手。

sentences.english: On the other side, the clouds break out of an encirclement, die crazy rescued seriously uncle cloud deep.
sentences.chinese: 另一邊，雲狂冒死突圍，救出了重傷的叔父雲深。

sentences.english: They returned safe and sound from a dangerous expedition.
sentences.chinese: 他們冒死探險，現已平安歸來。

sentences.english: He should escape from the Japanese camp, returned to Wuhan to stop.
sentences.chinese: 他冒死逃離日軍營地，返回武漢進行阻止。

sentences.english: To live is to risk dying .
sentences.chinese: 去生活較要冒死的風險。

definition: to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils
dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
to follow orders/to abide by/to obey
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
